text: Manilkara kanosiensis (commonly known as torem or sawaiNote: English translations for this reference are shown in braces. ) is a species of tree in the sapodilla family. It is thinly dispersed in low- lying rainforests over a large range, from the Maluku Islands of Indonesia to the Bismarck Archipelago (New Britain and New Ireland) of Papua New Guinea. It is endangered by the furious pace of logging in its native habitat, where it is felled as timber. ==References== kanosiensis Category:Plants described in 1941 Category:Endangered plants Category:Trees of the Maluku Islands Category:Flora of the Bismarck Archipelago Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Manilkara kanosiensis
